org.metacsp.time

Class SimpleDistanceConstraint

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.metacsp.framework.Constraint
      • org.metacsp.framework.BinaryConstraint
        • org.metacsp.time.SimpleDistanceConstraint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class SimpleDistanceConstraint
extends BinaryConstraint
    This class provides the fundamental building block for building STPs, namely the simple distance constraint type used by the APSPSolver STP solve.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Returns:

        public boolean removeInterval(Bounds i)
        Remove an [lb,ub] interval between the two TimePoints of this constraint.
        Parameters:
        i - The interval to remove.
        Returns:
        true if the interval was removed, false if this was an attempt to remove the active constraint.

      • getEdgeLabel

        public java.lang.String getEdgeLabel()
        Description copied from class: Constraint
        Every Constraint should implement this method - its value is what is drawn by the ConstraintNetwork rendering methods.
        Specified by:
        getEdgeLabel in class Constraint
        Returns:
        a String representation of the constraint to be used for ConstraintNetwork rendering.

      • clone

        public SimpleDistanceConstraint clone()
        Specified by:
        clone in class Constraint

      • normalize

        public final SimpleDistanceConstraint normalize()
        Inverts the constraint if its lower bound is negative. At the time of writing negative constraints could not be used, e.g. constraints whose minimum and maximum values are negative. If this becomes possible in the future, this function will have little use. (Since all constraint can't necessarily be expressed with positive bounds then.)
        Returns:
        A normalized copy the original constraint.

      • invert

        public final SimpleDistanceConstraint invert()
        Inverts the from and to reference of this constraints and updates the minimum and maximum bounds accordingly.
        Returns:
        an inverted copy of this constraint.

      • isEquivalent

        public boolean isEquivalent(Constraint c)
        Description copied from class: Constraint
        Method for assessing the "equivalence" between two constraints. This is not used for lookups nor comparisons (hence, it is not the equals method).
        Specified by:
        isEquivalent in class Constraint
        Parameters:
        c - The Constraint to compare against.
        Returns:
        true iff the two constraints are considered to be equivalent.
